p: RVA mixed infection rate has increased globally from 7.9–11.7% from 1997 to 2007 [ 9, 114]. The RVA mixed infection rate observed in the present study is 0.7% which is similar to previous reports [ 23, 24, 26– 28]. The total of 2.4% of the study samples were P-Non-typeable even with different primer sets. The possible reasons for genotyping failure might be the primer mismatch due to higher RVA diversity.
